origin_of_ch_char_book: The King connects Heaven and Earth. The trinity of Heaven, Earth and Human is also reflected in the character which means king: (ç‹, wang, king). The three horizontal lines mean sky, human and earth, and the vertical line means the connection of the three elements each other. So this word is interpreted as the person who connects heaven and earth, the holy king. On the other hand, I think this character depicts a big man () wearing something like a flat hat (), who is standing on a flat platform () and with his arms and legs spread widely, ordering others. Ancient East Asian civilizations were discovered in the North Eastern area of China. Sculptures of ancient kings (or Shamans) unearthed at these archaeological sites show that they wore headdresses which were flat. The meaning of the flat shape could be to show that this person is â€œ a big man who can connect Heaven and Earth and Human.â€ In ancient China, the king thought to himself as the center of the world. (å¤®, yang, middle) consists of the king å¤§ (da, big), and the H-shaped symbol that means from border to border. Putting these symbols together, we can see the symbol means the king who reigns over the whole land. This king had a variety of decorations on his head to show he was something special.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Wang " is to turn the word "æˆ‰" by ninety degrees and turn the whole word to distinguish it from the original word. The early inscriptions on the inscriptions were arc-shaped, and the arc pen was generous, still retaining the shape of a sharp edge. In the later period, the lines of the inscriptions on the base paintings became a horizontal line, which was easy to be confused with the character "ç‰". The difference is that the first two horizontal paintings of "ç‹" are closer, and the distance from the base painting is far away, while the characters of "ç‰" are three horizontal lines. The distance between them is similar. Later, in order to further distinguish between the two characters, a point was added to the character "ç‰".

The oracle bone inscriptions " king " and " shi " are represented by the same glyph (Lin Yuan), because the axe is not only a symbol of royal power, but also an implement held by a warrior. See " shi ".

Oracle mostly refers to the king of Shang, and "Collection" 5193 is: "Zheng: Wang Gui".

The inscriptions on gold mean the king, without a tripod: "The kings are in the Zhou Temple", which means that the king came to the Zhou Temple. Attacking Wu Wang Jian: "Attack Wu Wang Fu Cha, choose Jue Ji Jin, from the first (as) the imperial mirror", which means that Wu Wang Fu Cha chooses hard bronze and casts the mirror for daily use. "The prince" is the son of the king, and the prince wuding: "the prince noon chooses his auspicious gold."

The bamboo slips of the Warring States period represent the monarch and emperor. "Lao Zi Jia" Jane 13: "Hou Wang can keep it." "Guodian Jane. Jane 33-34: "Mu Muwen King". "Guodian Jane. "Six Virtues" Jane 39-40: "It is also the people of the ancient (hence) ancient kings." "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Congzheng A" Jane 1: "The King of Ming Dynasty (the one who has) the world in the past three yi (generation)". "Shangbo Bamboo Book IV. Cao Mo's Chen" Jian 64: "This King's Supreme Way". "Tsinghua Jane II. "Lian Year" Jane 3: "Ten and Four Years, Li Wang Sheng Xuan Wang". It also means to rule and be king, and "king the world" means to rule the world. "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 42: "The husband is to win the people and rule the world. The king of Tang in the world is thirty and (has) one life, and he is made by (çº£), receiving (çº£) does not describe the way of the first king." It is said that the support of the people is the king of the world. Tang claimed that the king of the world was replaced by Zhou ascended the throne after the thirty-first generation, and Zhou did not follow the rule of the first king.

"Said Wen": "The king, the world returns. Dong Zhongshu said: the ancient writers, three paintings and even the king of them. The three, the heaven, the earth and the people. And the one who can pass, the king. Confucius said : Always three kings. All kings belong to the king. ğ ™», the king of ancient Chinese."
humanum_short_description_en: Axe shaped like an axe with a downward blade and a golden inscription (Wu Qichang). The axe is a symbol of military power and is therefore king.
